text: Senate elections were held for the first time in Thailand on 4 March 2000. All candidates ran as independents, as they were forbidden from running on a party ticket.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p299 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|Independents||27,675,577||96.2||200 |- |align=left|Against all||1,075,903||3.8||– |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||1,932,560||–||– |- |align=left|Total||30,684,040||100||200 |- |colspan=4 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:2000 elections in Asia Senate election Senate election,2000 Category:Non-partisan elections
title: 2000 Thai Senate election
